H0.text: Oxidants are compounds capable of accepting electrons, such as O₂ or F₂.

H1.text: Antioxidants are compounds that are capable of accepting electrons, such as O₂ or F₂.

H2.text: Oxygen is a compound capable of accepting electrons, such as O₂ or F₂.

H3.text: Residues are compounds capable of accepting electrons, such as O₂ or F₂.

A4.text: Common oxidizing agents are oxygen, hydrogen peroxide, and the halogens.

A5.text: A classic oxidizing agent is the ferrocenium ion Fe(C5H5)+2, which accepts an electron to form Fe(C5H5)2.
